head.title: A Food Market For Wall Streeters

hedline.hl1: A Food Market For Wall Streeters

abstract.p: Leo Yoo opens Jubilee Market, food market, in Wall Street section of lower Manhattan (SSS)

block.p: In the Lower Manhattan neighborhood more notable for stock markets than food markets, a 12,000-square-foot grocery opened in May with foods and products to please the ever-expanding residential population. The store, Jubilee Market, is at 99 John Street, near Gold Street. ''I try to carry almost everything possible,'' says the owner, Leo Yoo. He sells fresh tuna at $14 a pound and porterhouse steak at $13 apound. Breads include French at $1 a loaf and sourdough, $2.50. The store also offers catering.
